reviewText:
If Hollywood needs to make a pro-this or pro-that movie, more power to them. All I ask is that they make said movie realistic and enjoyable. This is a long PSA in favor of homosexuality. I have to believe, based on the generic blandness of this movie, not to mention the lack of realism in events and dialogue and the poor acting, that event the most ardent gay supporter blushed with embarrassment. I have seen middle school plays that had better acting and were more authentic. Nothing about the short bit I watched was remotely realistic. Annette O'Toole is as frumpy a school marm as they come, and Lenny as a Lawyer? Implausible!

The better name for this should have been Horrid Putrid.

I beg to differ with the 4- and 5-star reviews.  This was simply another second-rate tv movie with mediocre acting, a "twisted" plot (as opposed to a plot with twists and turns), and often awkward dialogue and/or timing. It is a 2-star movie at best.

But it kept freezing and the struggle to get it going again constantly was just too much. That has been my streaming experience with Amazon lately. Don't know why and Amazon has not been helpful in telling me how to correct this.
A conplete waste of time.  The plot is terrible and the acting is worse.  If I wasn't working third shift and it wasn't 0237 i would have turned it off after 3 minutes

I enjoyed this movie. The alternate justice that prevailed made the movie all that more believable. The story of a sister losing it and kidnapping the lawyer responsible for getting her brother's murderer off scott free and her anger that the murderer was then making money for "his" story on top of the life insurance while her brother's reputation was dragged through the mud and causing their mother emotional distress and hurt in the process as the victim became the persecuted. Well, don't want to spoil it for you. Acting was superb and great plot well worth watching and left a satisfying feeling at the end of the movie that even when justice isn't truly served, what goes around comes around.

A strong look back 30 odds years to the days of Aids phobia. Another disturbing view of how the Law system can be manipulated for the worst. It is without doubt the best acting I have seen from Michael McKean.

Everything about this movie was very well done and the acting was amazing. Annette O'Toole did such a good job in this movie i can not even put it into words. Michael McKean did great as well, and seeing him do a serious role other then his usual comedy was great to see. Over all, this is a very good movie and i think everything who see's it will not be disappointed.

If you love Annette, you'll love this movie. She is awesome in it. If you don't love her, it is still a great movie. If you've ever secretely dreamed of getting revenge, then dream on. I love it when she makes him.... ah "wet himself". I laughed till I cried. Oh by the way, she later married the creep in real life.
This is one of Annette's better movies.
Film was nice, watched w/my kids.
Well played.

The film feels a bit dated, but is worth watching. Annette O'Toole is fabulous in her portrayal of Gwen, the sister of a murder victim whose murderer gets off by his attorney's focus on vilifying the victim. On the spur of the moment, Gwen kidnaps Hammond, the defense attorney, and tries to see if he can feel any remorse for his tactics. When she goes on trial for his kidnapping, a successful attorney asks to defend her because it is every attorney's dream to square off with Hammond. The end has a surprise twist that I never saw coming and I usually have these kind of movies figured out way before the end. Enjoy!

The stereotypes are ridiculous and the dialog contrived.

Not plausible. The attorney didn't fight back. He was handcuffed to the footed bath tub for crying out loud. They don't bolt those down. Then she handcuffed him to a rickety chair. I wish they showed how she undressed and dressed him without him overpowering her. Even with handcuffs, he could hit her in the head. The attorney sounded a little like John Ritter. I kept thinking this was like Chrissy tying up Jack Tripper as a zany stunt... "Come and knock on our door...  We've been waiting for you....  Where the kisses are hers and hers and his,  Three's company too." Okay, sorry about that. I was having a little flashback. So then I'm thinking this movie is like a cross between "Midnight Run" and "Misery, except that those movies were good. So anyway, it hits me, how great would it be if Kathy Bates was in a movie with Charles Grodin. Kathy: "Now the time has come. I put two bullets in my gun. One for me, and one for you. Oh darling, it will be so beautiful." Charles: Uh, I don't like guns. They scare me. Put the gun down. Can I ask you something? Have you properly maintained that gun? You know, they can explode if you don't clean them properly. Can you take these cuffs off me, Kathy? They hurt really bad."  Okay back to the movie. I don't want to spend too much time on it though, so let me finish up. Annette O'Toole's character changed so much, I thought she might have multiple personality disorder. Prim and proper. Angry. Gloomy. Happy and laughing. Immature. Misty eyed. One person can't be all those things. Unless of course you are Sally Field in "Sybil".  Sally: I don't want to see the kitty cat." "I'm going to New York". "I want my suitcase". "Don't come next to me." They said not to go to the movies." "Do I go to the movies? No."  Yeah. That's more like it. And Sally, you may be crazy, but you know not to go to the movies...especially when the movie is "Final Justice".
Good movie from beginning to end

Was it the editor, director or writer that emasculated this movie - pun intended!

How could they? Make the almost-brilliant plan of a victim's sister to outsmart a brilliant vicious lawyer succeed due to a fluke? There was no need for that at all. It made her look dumb. She could have planned the taping and stated that it was random while staging the coffee incident a without a hitch. She could have easily let the guy escape making him think he was smart enough to escape. No hint of either was there - thus making a good movie terrible in 20 seconds.

If it was editor or director, I hope someone does something like that - only brilliant, not random, to them.
I have been looking for this movie for years. It was on before we had a VCR and I never saw the end.

A fitting title for this movie. An arrogant sleezy lawyer got caught with his hand in the cookie jar and the kidnapper got her just deserts. But so much in this movie was overlooked, surely no real police force, prosecutor didn't do his job in the trial and lots was left to your imagination. It did hold your interest and had some funny scenes which lightened the mood somewhat but all around the characters were rather off, the kidnapper too layed back, the lawyer not even trying to overpower the woman although he is twice her size, kinda like he's not all there even though he gets all bent out of shape, so he's all bark and no bite.

Entertaining movie.  Lifetime style is recognized throughout my husband said.  We had problems with streaming the movie, as we had to stop and restart several times.

Have you ever wondered why attorneys at trial or deposition are never put under oath?  Corollary question:  how can you tell when a lawyer is lying?  This is a story which is quite on point regarding legal ethics or lack thereof.  The concept is fine and deserving of broader discussion--ie, when a trial about a murdered man is made out to be (by the defense attorney) a trial of the decedent's homosexuality.  Although it should be obvious that a person's sexual preference does not have anything to do with the fact that a murder can be excused because of it.  The actors were good, tho not great.  This movie somehow did not generate the tension that a "grade A" picture should possess.  Therefore, "Final Justice", although posing some interesting ethical problems, is a "B movie"---not bad, but yet missing the mark.
Normally, I would evaluate a movie when it starts and if it displeases me, I will instantly shut it off. This movie was great and I like Annette O'Tolle

This is one of those mystery that you can not watch all the way through.  It has twists and turns that you can't miss.  When you think you have it figured out, wrong.  It was a great movie, and I would recommend it to everyone. My favorite say" What goes around, comes around".

Being a former law student and continuously involved in studysing aspects of the legal system, I find this film, though fictional, captivating for several reasons.  Not the least of which, is how skewed toward those with property and money it has become!.  Having the power to influence decisions has taken Justice out of all court proceedings and made a mockery of the Jurisprudence System.  Every State Dept. of Corrections level of law enforcement has made inappropriate and legally binding decisions through our errant precedent setting system fallible and just plain wrong.  People today without money or property are urged by court appointed attorneys normally Public Defenders to urge their clients to plead guilty and enter into a faulty and disgusting deceitful apparatus full of chicanery, artifice, and deception.  This film highlights the process by which this system is perped on an unsuspecting public who could care less what happens to the lower end of the economic spectrum.  That's why so many Capital Cases have been reversed once the suppressed "real evidence" is opened for a full airing of the facts rather than the plea bargain agreements leading to a conviction of an innocent party often placing them on death row!!
This really is a movie about justice.  I love what Annette does to get some  Justice.  I just love this movie.

It's difficult to compare plot lines from a 1990's movie to those of movies coming out in 2013. In comparison to the plot lines in movies today, I found Merle Hammond to be overly submissive to the demands of Gwen Saticoy and the story line involving the kidnapping was very weak.
I loved this movie.  Finally, these super lawyers are victims themselves. This gave a lot of insight into what theses high powered lawyers think of juries.
I completely enjoyed this movie.  I would recommend this movie to friends and family - enjoy.  Will probably watch again

Merle Hammond, (Michael McKean) a sleazy attorney uses corrupt tactics and convinces a jury to acquit his client who is a killer. Gwen, the murdered victim's sister, (Annette O' Toole) knows the real truth and plots revenge against the attorney.

Out of desperation, she kidnaps the attorney in an attempt to make him confess to his unscrupulous him confess to his unscrupulous tactics. The cards twist when he escapes and puts her on trial for his kidnapping.
Liked the action. Would give 4 1/2 but can not post the 1/2  this movie keep my attention. I did not go to sleep
Is a nice, slow movie. The actors are great, It was nice to see Annette O;Toole again. But is a little to slow for me
I really enjoyed this one.  I especially liked that it had a great message in it... what goes around comes around.  Very well done and interesting.
changed. I don't know what happened to Ms. O'toole but she was popular back then, and just faded out.  She is not even listed  (that I could find) redheads of the 70's or 80's. Too bad.
The plot is a bit th in. This is a typical boy meets girl romance with a bit of drama mixed in but it fails in substance.

Oh, Annette O'Toole makes it all believable and real. She is a wonderful actress and is supported by other very good actors. This is a twist to the corrupt attorneys getting the bad guy off. However, this script makes it work.  The filming and directing is top notch. The twists and turns of the story cannot be anticipated, but serve the story and "justice" very well.  It is a keeper.  I've watched it three times now and I'm not tired of it yet.
Low budget, low return. Waste of 3/4 of the time.  Fair story line just not well presented. Not exactly a cliff hanger
A well directed and produced film with superior acting and a plot that keeps you guessing. This is one not to miss.

This was a story about true justice that came about with a twist in the circumstances. It was well written and I enjoyed viewing it. It omitted vulgarity and sexual content to make it's point and the moral of the story was well portrayed. Would that more movies like this show up in the viewing selection!
This older movie that was just released is an exciting drama that kept us on the edge of our seats through the whole thing.

I can't imagine anyone giving this movie five stars; that's just wrong. Just as wrong as the date Amazon stated the movie was released. Amazon states this movie was released in 2013 when the correct release date was 1998. What a waste of time watching this predictable movie that gives made for TV movies a bad name.
Enjoyable movie. Not complex good way to pass time. Nice since it was prime instant view.reminds me of a made for TV movie.
I remember this made-for-tv movie when it first came out.  I was a kid then so I wanted to see it as an adult.  It didn't have as much depth as I remembered but it's still a nice movie.

It was one of the better made for tv movies I have seen in a while. Her brother or sister was killed I can't remerber it has been some time back when I saw it but she wanted to hurt his lawyer for getting the killer off you can take it from there.

There is a certain satisfaction when the "bad guy" gets his own and this movie does that in a tasteful manner.  I'm a big fan of Annette and she certainly shines in this venue. As another reviewer stated it is good to see Dennis in a serious role...he does make a good "bad guy" without fitting any stereotype per se. It is a good illustration of how ruthless people can take advantage of our jury system and victimize the victim even further for the sake of winning.
I REALLY LIKE THE MOVIE. IT`S WORK GREAT AND NOTHING WRONG WITH THE MOVIE THANKS FOR MAIL OUT TO ME

Movie about a woman's Gay brother who is murdered & the friend who killed him has an atty who uses homosexualality as reason for it. The victim's sister kidnaps the atty, to get him to confess the inappropriate legal way he got the murderer acquitted.  Website description of this movie says nothing about homosexuality.
Even though the characters are fictional, Annette O'Toole and Michael MacKean ended up dating and eventually married after the making of this movie. They've been married ever since.
